result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeramiah A. Jefferson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTE, schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.  

Take medications as prescribed once approved by agent.

AODA and follow up. 

Psychological evaluation and follow up.  Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

to Judge Jacobson from DOC
of Proceedings from Sentencing Hearing; On March 2, 2016 in Br 3 before the Honorable LaMont K Jacobson

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:04 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Paul Goetz. 
COURT questions parties re: PSI. Parties state no additions/corrections. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 10 years imprisonment - 4 years IC and 6 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES: absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; take prescription medications as prescribed once approved by agent; AODA and follow up; psychological evaluation and follow up; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 694 days sentence credit. 
COURT finds the deft is eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT remands deft into custody for transport to WI State Prison System. 
COURT allows counsel to retain their copies of PSI and reminds them to maintain their confidentiality. 

Adj: 3:58 pm
Copies of PSI sent to parties;  ADA Mayo via email; Attorney Goetz via hard copy
Sentencing hearing at 03-02-2016 03:00 pm
